## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hey, I had a question about the testnet reset. I didn't delete my wallet files, so how do I recover my VRSCTEST wallet now?

**AI Assistant:**
To recover your VRSCTEST wallet after the testnet reset, you should delete the VRSCTEST directories before running the new update. The directories to delete are: `~/.komodo/vrsctest` on Linux, `⁨Users⁩/⁨{YourUserName}/⁨Library⁩/⁨Application Support⁩/⁨Komodo/vrsctest` on MacOS, and `"%APPDATA%"\Komodo\VRSCTEST` on Windows. Failing to do so may cause issues with your wallet. Make sure to delete those directories before running the update, and you should be good to go!

**User:**

How do I recover my VRSCTEST wallet after the testnet reset, since my wallet files were not deleted?

You should delete the VRSCTEST directories before running the new update. The directories to delete are: `~/.komodo/vrsctest` on Linux, `⁨Users⁩/⁨{YourUserName}/⁨Library⁩/⁨Application Support⁩/⁨Komodo/vrsctest` on MacOS, and `"%APPDATA%"\Komodo\VRSCTEST` on Windows. Failing to do so may cause issues with your wallet.

## Testnet Reset
The testnet was deleted and relaunched on this release. **IF YOU HAVE LAST LAUNCHED VRSCTEST FROM A VERSION PRIOR TO THIS, PLEASE DELETE THE FOLLOWING DIRECTORIES BEFORE RUNNING THIS NEW UPDATE:**
**Linux:**
```
~/.komodo/vrsctest
```**MacOS**
```
 ⁨Users⁩/⁨{YourUserName}/⁨Library⁩/⁨Application Support⁩/⁨Komodo/vrsctest
```**Windows**
```
"%APPDATA%"\Komodo\VRSCTEST
